fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* When future sprint has 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' configured in AO_60DB71_SPRINT table due to unknown reason, users will not be able to rename the future from the board in the UI. 
* No errors will be returned during the re-naming. In the har file, we will see 400 error unable to rename due to "the start date of a sprint must be before the end date". 
* If the user refreshes the UI after renaming the sprint, the name will revert back to its original name as the sprint was never renamed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Manually insert the same value of 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' for multiple future sprints in the same board. Or insert the same value of 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' for one future sprint, then insert a different value of 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' for another future sprint in the same board. 
 # Rename any of the future sprints on the board, you will experience the issue for one of the future sprints where after renaming and refreshing the browser, the name reverts back to its original name. 
# If you collect the har file during renaming, you will see the error "the start date of a sprint must be before the end date". 

h3. Expected Results

Jira should return an error indicating that the future sprint can't be renamed due to it has 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' configured. 

h3. Actual Results

User was able to rename the sprint without any error, but the name reverts back to its original name after refreshing the browser. 

h3. Workaround

* Remove 'START_DATE' and 'END_DATE' column in the AO_60DB71_SPRINT table for all the future sprints that were affected by the issue. 
* Or click on 'start sprint' to edit the sprint name and set a future date. Using this method will start the sprint a even when a future start date is configured.
fields.summary: Unable to rename a future sprint due to the start date of a sprint must be before the end date

fields.description:
We have some API documentation to get a list of deleted worklogs in Jira: https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/7.13.0/#api/2/worklog-getIdsOfWorklogsDeletedSince

Currently, it's not specified in the API documentation that this time needs to be listed in milliseconds for the API call to pass properly. If the time isn't passed in milliseconds, it will return all API results of deleted worklogs, regardless of your {{since}} parameter.

Requesting update to this documentation to make that clear.
fields.summary: Clarification on API documentation for deleted worklogs

fields.description:
h3. Description
Currently, text type fields do not return any suggestions on autocompleting via JQL. It also returns an empty set of data if using the {{autocompletedata/suggestions}} endpoint.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow this type of fields to return suggested values when using the autocomplete feature for JQL searches.

fields.description:
Hello,

I work for [Elements|[https://elements-apps.com/]]  as developer. Elements is a software editor which publish Elements Connect formely NFeed.

Elements Connect allow you to create some specific custom field called Elements Connect field. When we use our Element Connect field on the advanced search we allow the user to use equals operator ("=") and "contains" operator ("~").

This feature create some degraded operations that we explain in detail [here|[https://valiantys.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/NFEED512X/pages/976715777/How+does+the+autocomplete+on+Element+Connect+Fields+works+in+advanced+search+mode]].

To fix the problem we ask if it's possible to remove all suggestions after a contains operator in the  advanced search (even if the field doesn't support the "~" operator in search). 

Kind regards,

Basile GRANDPERRET
fields.summary: Remove suggests options after contains operator ("~") in advanced search

fields.description:

* https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-can-users-disable-Jira-email-notifications/qaq-p/392674
* JRASERVER-2644
* JRASERVER-1369

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have a very long description in a Jira issue, so long that a scrollbar appears when you edit the issue, in the visual edit mode, copying any section of text with Ctrl + C causes the scrollbar in that edit dialog to jump to the top of that box unexpectedly. Happens only in visual editor mode, not Text mode, and while using the in-line edit feature. Only happens in IE 11. Firefox and Chrome not affected.
h3. Environment
 * IE11
 * Jira 7.9.2, 7.13.1, 8.1.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a multiline text field using the wiki-renderer, (e.g. the description) in an issue
 # Make sure this description has a lot of content, enough to make sure that a scrollbar appears in the edit mode.
 # Make sure you're in "Visual" mode, as this problem does not happen in Text mode
 # with your mouse, click and drag to highlight some text at the bottom of this dialog, while still in edit mode
 # Press Ctrl+C to copy that text

h3. Expected Results

The view does not change and the scroll bar stays where it is.
h3. Actual Results

The scroll bar jumps to the top
h3. Notes
 * IE browser console does not appear to show any error or changes when this happens.
 * I was only able to reproduce this with IE11, with Chrome and Firefox I was not able to reproduce it.

 
h3. Workaround
 * Press an arrow key after the scroll bar jumped. This takes you back to the cursor.
 * Or use "Text" mode when copying (won't preserve formatting in the same way)
fields.summary: Copying description content of a Jira issue in IE 11 while in the visual editor mode causes scrollbar to jump to the top unexpectedly

fields.description:
Unbounded export of large archive can be very slow and consume a lot of resources including database load, CPU and connection bandwidth.

Jira 8.2 comes with additional filters on export archive page which allow admins to limit the set of exported issues:

 * filtering with properties: project, issue type, reporter, assignee, archiver and archived date
fields.summary: Filters on export archive page

fields.description:
When exporting a filter to CSV file, both  "Progress" and "∑ Progress" fields are not exported.
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a filter, add "Progress" and "∑ Progress" fields to columns
 # Click Export > CSV (Current Fields) or CSV (All fields)

+Expected behaviour:+

"Progress" and "∑ Progress" fields to be exported to the CSV file

+Observed behaviour:+

Neither of the columns are present in the CSV file
h3. Workaround

None

 

*Notes:*
 * When exporting to HTML, both fields are exported correctly
 * In Jira 7.1.x, when exporting to Excel, both fields were exported correctly
fields.summary: Exporting a filter to a CSV file does not export "Progress" and "∑ Progress" fields

fields.description:

I would like to run a report in JIRA to show all the EPICS with their total number of issues, broken down by how many are completed, how many are estimated and how many are unestimated, which should equal the aforementioned total number of issues.

fields.description:
Currently, when importing issues from a CSV file, using the "External System Import", to UPDATE existing issues, Jira requires the "Summary" field.

This is required even if you're not changing the summary of the issue.

The only required field should be the issue key itself which is used to find the issue you're trying to update.
fields.summary: CSV Import of existing issues shouldn't require the summary field.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is no way to import comments into Jira with the visibility set to Private in *Jira Service Desk*, or set to a specific Role or Group in *Jira Software*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option in the JSON importer to set the comment visibility, as it is currently possible in the Jira comment endpoints for *Jira Service Desk* and *Jira Software*.
fields.summary: Add comment visibility option to JSON importer

fields.description:
Currently, if a field has been saved with HTML or wiki markup, and the field is using a Dafault Text renderer, the notifications are being sent using the value of the field as-is, including all code, tags and scripting. This can make notifications unreadable.

This behavior is also present when viewing the History tab in the issue view.

The suggestion is to:
# Allow a better handling of the issue history to show only text, without markup.
# For Jira to send notifications cleaning up all markup/html/scripting detected so the code will be readable.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to configure Text style mail notifications to filter out any markup and scripting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom field page had a new look and feel introduced in [Jira 7.12|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/jira-core-7-12-x-release-notes-955179462.html#JiraCore7.12.xreleasenotes-new_cfs]. Also added was a quick search box.  

However, using the quick search may return results that are not related to the search string as the search incorporates results from screen name as well. In other words, the search is not limited to custom field name. 

h3. Environment
This is reproducible on a vanilla instance

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen. For example 'CustomizedUniqueScreen'
# Create 2 custom fields. For example 'CustomField' and 'NothingRelatedHere'
# Associate both the custom fields to the new screen
# Go to Jira Administration > Issues > Custom field 
# Search with the word {{Custom}} or {{custom}} or partial word {{cus}}
# Verify the results

h3. Expected Results
Only custom fields with the name that has the string _{{Custom}}_ or _{{custom}}_ or partial word _{{cus}}_ should be returned

h3. Actual Results
Custom fields 'CustomField' and 'NothingRelatedHere' are returned (based on the above example). This is due to the 'NothingRelatedHere' field was associated to a screen with the name that contain the search string

!customfieldsearch.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Ensure screen names are unique
fields.summary: Incorrect results for custom field quick search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When entering an invalid value for a POST call to at the Add share permission endpoint gives invalid values in the error noting as valid causing confusion in troubleshooting the error:


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [POST /rest/api/2/filter/{id}/permission | https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.1.0/#api/2/filter-addSharePermission]
 # using invalid option for data package

h3. Expected Results
The error output will show Valid values (Noting case sensativity): project, group, projectRole, global, authenticated

h3. Actual Results
The API return with the following error:
{code}
{
"errorMessages": [
"Invalid type given. Should be one of [PROJECT, GROUP, PROJECT_ROLE, GLOBAL, AUTHENTICATED, USER]"
],
"errors": {}
}
{code}

h3. Notes
This gives improper values as valid options noting invalid case sensitivity as well: "Should be one of [PROJECT, GROUP, PROJECT_ROLE, GLOBAL, AUTHENTICATED, USER]"

h3. Workaround
Use the Valid values (Noting case sensitivity): project, group, projectRole, global, authenticated
fields.summary: Invalid error output on API endpoint
Correct REST API Documentation for ReindexIssues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
During deleting Issue Jira calls _*DefaultFileSystemAttachmentStore#deleteAttachmentContainerForIssue()*_ method. This method under the hood gets directory from _*FileSystemAttachmentDirectoryAccessor#getAttachmentDirectory()*_ and if directory exists this method removes this directory.

If the directory for issue does not exist, the method _*FileSystemAttachmentDirectoryAccessor#getAttachmentDirectory()*_ creates this directory. 
That leads to the following course of actions:
* Jira creates a directory 
* and after that immediately removes it. 

This situation can cause the performance issue if the customer makes a lot of deleting operations. The I/O operations can be a bottleneck for Jira in that case.

h3. Suggested Solution
Do not create attachment directory during deleting Issue

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Do not create attachment directory during deleting Issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating issues from CSV (*Issues > Create issues from CSV*), should the field is not present in the 'Create Issue' screen, the CSV import will be completed without the missing fields' value in the created issues. Though seems to be expected, it is however very misleading as the validator will not detect this as a problem. Also, the fields can be mapped prior to executing the import process, further making the user think all the mapped fields will be imported over.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have the validator detect if any of the mapped fields are not included in the 'Create Issues' screen.

Alternatively, prevent or warn users when trying to map fields that are not included in the 'Create Issue' screen.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Improve CSV Import Validator to check fields in 'Create Issue' screen

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to bulk edit tickets via CSV import via (issues > import issues from CSV). It would be glad if we could edit issue via CSV import.

It is available in external system import tools but not for CSV import via (issues > import issues from CSV)
fields.summary: CSV Import Bulk Edit JIRA Issue (Issues > Import Issues From CSV)

fields.summary: Ability to display the whole name of the type in Custom field section

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After updating to 7.13 the new admin page for Custom Fields no longer all displays on one page but instead has a search box. The problem is if we search for something like "OS", instead of the custom field named "OS" it gives us 7 pages worth of results. There's no way for us to know what page the actual "OS" field is on.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement the ability to limit the search to custom field name only, and not description. Otherwise, this is literally usable for many generic custom field names.
fields.summary: Ability to to limit the search only to custom field name in custom fields management view

fields.description:
As described in our documentation at [Changing server.xml to handle requests with special characters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-xml-to-handle-requests-with-special-characters-958453799.html], the {{server.xml}} has been modified to handle the Tomcat upgrade to 8.5.32.

Also listed in the documentation is that brand new installs 7.12.3 and on will contain the characters already listed in the file but upgrades from a version before 7.12.3 will require the characters be added in manually to the {{server.xml}} file. 

This can add manual work in during an upgrade and while it can be easily fixed, it would be good if the upgrade could manually handle modifying the {{server.xml}} to contain the characters in an uncommented out connector.
fields.summary: Update server.xml automatically between upgrades to contain relaxedPathChars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you initiate a project key change through REST API _+PUT+_ /rest/api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey} , the operations does not trigger a project reindex/background reindex. The same operation done through the UI triggers a project reindex.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a project and edit the key through the UI ([http://HOST/secure/project/EditProject!default.jspa?pid=XXXXX|http://host/secure/project/EditProject!default.jspa?pid=XXXXX] )
 # Notice a project reindex is triggered
 # Now update the key again, but using REST API _+PUT+_ /rest/api/2/project/\{projectIdOrKey}
 # Notice that the project reindex is not triggered

h3. Expected Results

The UI and REST API behavior should be standardized, which means that the REST API should trigger a reindex or the UI behavior should be changed. 
h3. Notes

Changing the project key on the UI generates a taskId for the project reindex while the REST API does not even try to create a task:

!image-2019-04-23-09-00-18-918.png|width=680,height=227!
h3. Workaround

Trigger a manual project reindex if editing the project key via REST API
fields.summary: Project Key change triggered though REST API doesn't trigger Project Reindex like UI does

fields.description:
Currently Jira captures the last time an issue was updated.  And while Jira 8.x introduces JQL to search based on who last updated an issue, it would be helpful to have a real system field "lastUpdatedBy" that gets set to the user name of the user who last updated an issue.  This field could be displayed along with other "People" fields.  It would also be available in JQL as in "lastUpdatedBy = currentUser()" or similar.

This is preferable to each customer implementing their own custom field and updating via a custom listener or post-functions.
fields.summary: Add a system field for "last updated by" and set for each issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In [Connecting to an LDAP directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0712/connecting-to-an-ldap-directory-959313431.html]  documentation, _Advanced settings > Connection Timeout (seconds)_ Default value is 0 but actual default value is 10.

{quote}
|Connection Timeout (seconds)|This setting affects two actions. The default value is 0. 
- The time to wait when getting a connection from the connection pool. A value of 0 (zero) means there is no limit, so wait indefinitely. 
- The time, in seconds, to wait when opening new server connections. A value of 0 (zero) means that the TCP network timeout will be used, which may be several minutes.|
{quote}
fields.summary: Connection Timeout default value is wrong in LDAP directory document

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Inconsistent issue data for bug, Jira 8 and 8.0.2 - we got while changed the bug status from TO - In Progress

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - created the bug (issue) with status TO-DO.
 - created the 3 test cases(issue) in test case.
 - mapped the same bug to all above 3 test case.
 - open the same bug and modified the TO-DO status into In Progress,then i got an inconstant data from the jira, like instead of In Progress status, I got TO-DO status.
 - for creating and modifying the issue i called the jira - IssueEvent class.
 - for retrieving the issue from the jira i used web-hook class below, after so much investigation and debug i fond this below method is giving inconsistent data.
Issue issue = issueManager.getIssueObject(defectId);
 - once we modify the bug status from TO-DO to In Progress,
Issue issue = issueManager.getIssueObject(defectId);

h3. Expected Results

Once the status is modified from TODO to In Progress the webhook should return In Progress

h3. Actual Results
The webhook returned TODO when the status was In Progress.
 
h3. Notes

Raised by customer:

[https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ATLASSDK-166]

Also, raised in community by customer:
[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Inconsistent-issue-data-for-bug-Jira-8-Issue-issue-issueManager/qaq-p/1035407#M331528]

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: issueManager.getIssueObject(defectId) provides inconsistent status results

fields.description:
As a Jira User/Admin I would like to add rule based [Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-event-938847495.html] based on Events.

For example I'd like to specify that if an "Issue Created" event is fired and the "assignee is EMPTY" then the Project Lead is notified.

This seems more intuitive to me than creating a [Custom Event|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/adding-a-custom-event-938847495.html] named "Issue Created Unassigned" and adding it to all my workflow creation transitions.
fields.summary: Notification Scheme rule based Event Notifications

Not sure if technically possible, but just a thought.
fields.summary: Ability to mark things Favorite for Group Pickers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the REST API rest/api/2.0/attachments allows you to upload attachments with invalid characters in the name.

When you go to access those images, Jira presents the error
{noformat}
Ouch! We can't load the image{noformat}
!Screen Shot 2019-04-22 at 12.06.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an attachment with any invalid characters in its filename.
 # Use the REST call rest/api/2.0/attachments and upload the attachment with the bad filename.
 # Attempt to load the attachment. 

h3. Expected Results

The REST call should fail if there are any invalid characters in the filename.
h3. Actual Results

The attachment is uploaded but users are unable to access the attachment. 
h3. Workaround

Modify the file name of the attachments so as to not include any of the invalid characters. 
{code:java}
 File names cannot contain any of these characters: '\', '/','\"', '%', ':', '$', '?', '*'.{code}
fields.summary: rest/api/2.0/attachments allows for uploading of attachments with invalid characters.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Importer Plugin allows multiple projects to be imported from FogBugz (On Demand) . The importer however, does not import the links correctly when multiple FogBugz projects are mapped to a Single Jira projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple projects in FogBugz (On Demand)
 # Import the projects from Jira

h3. Expected Results

All projects' issues and their links are imported successfully.
h3. Actual Results

All issues are imported successfully. However, the links are only created for the last project that was imported.
h3. Notes

The FogBugz project import [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-fogbugz-for-your-server-938847577.html] mentions that the projects are imported on a 'Per-project basis'. However, this does not clearly explain why the links are not created as the import logs show that all the issues are created first and the links are only imported after that.
h3. Workaround

Re-import the projects again.
fields.summary: Importing multiple FogBugz projects does not create Issue Links correctly
Make the latest Jira documentations available for download

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Descending tails on characters in the Create screen are cropped on the Select custom field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Select custom field with option includes 'y' 'g' 'j' or 'p' characters.
# Add the custom field to the create issue screen.
# Create issue using Create button.


h3. Expected Results
Select custom field show the characters without any issue.

h3. Actual Results
Option that includes characters 'y' 'g' 'j' or 'p' are cropped off on the screen.
 !Create Issue - Amirul JIRA 8 - Google Chrome 2019-04-22 11.15.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Also affected Select Custom field option in any screen that is used on the workflow.

h3. Workaround
Currently, the only workaround is to add below script to the announcement banner:
{code}
<style>
form.aui .aui-select2-container .select2-choices, form.aui .select, form.aui .text{
    height: 2.4em;
}
</style>
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Description

There's a fallback implementation of ordering issues by custom field which can't be sorted using Lucene.

This will cause {{n!}} executions of {{CustomField.getValue()}} which causes {{n!}} db queries for custom fields which are not loaded using {{EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister}} (EagerLoadingOfBizCustomFieldPersister has some extra caching for CFs which store their values in {{customfieldvalues}} table)
h3. Reproduction scenario
 # Create custom field which is not stored in {{customfieldvalue}} table.
 (I was using lexorank CF with disabled indexing)
 # Create 25 issues
 # Execute jql "{{ORDER BY <your custom field>"}}
 # Measure, how many times {{ImmutableCustomField#getValue}} was called
 ER: 25 (one {{getValue()}} for each issue)
 AR: 125 (much more {{getValue()}} than needed)

h3. Proposed solution

Reuse caching of custom field values inside {{IssueImpl}} and {{DocumentIssue}}
fields.summary: SortableCustomField executes too many db queries

h3. Issue Summary
The following stack traces are thrown in {{atlassian-jira.log}}
{code}
2019-04-19 19:41:35,100 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,100 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,101 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,101 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Administration > User Management > Users 
# Rename one of the users from the internal directory
# On the same page for the same user, click on the 3 dots beside _Edit_ and select *Edit user groups*.
# Start typing on the *Join selected group* box
# Check the {{atlassian-jira.log}}

This can also happen when a local group is added to an LDAP server and it is still stored with local=1 in the cwd_group table.

h3. Expected Results
No warnings in the logs

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{code}
2019-04-19 19:41:35,100 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,100 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,101 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
2019-04-19 19:41:35,101 http-nio-8080-exec-16 WARN admin 1181x451x1 6m3xs4 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/groups/picker [c.a.j.bc.group.GroupRelationshipChecker] Could not find directory with id -1
{code}


h3. Notes
No known impact so far. Just the repeated warnings in the logs.


h3. Workaround
If the problem is happening after a local group was added to the LDAP server, we can workaround by removing the group from the synchronization with a filter like the one below for example.
{noformat}(&(objectCategory=Group)(!(cn=jira-users))){noformat}
Please note this means the group will remain as a local group and users added to the group in the LDAP server will not show up in Jira as members.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JRASERVER-17783 introduced a feature that enable users to edit others' dashboard. But specifying user and group as editors at the same time removes individual users' right to edit dashboard, if the user is not in the group.
h3. Environment

Versions after JRASERVER-17783.
 i.e. [7.12.x -|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-12-x-release-notes-953676636.html#JiraSoftware7.12.xreleasenotes-filters] and later.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as any admin user
 Create _user1_ that doesn't belong to _jira-administrators_ group
 # Create custom dashboard and add _user1_ user and _jira-administrators_ group as editor
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-19 at 17.39.56.png|width=346,height=93!
 # Login as _user1_
 # Visit the custom dashboard created in step 2

{noformat}
Additional scenario:
# Create two groups (Group A, Group B)
# Create 3 users, User 1, User 2, User 3
# Add 3 users to group jira-users (the one that allow access to jira) and Group A
#  Add User 1 and User 2 to Group B
# With User 1 create dashboard, share it for view with jira-users
# Share created dashboard for edit for Group A and Group B
Expected result:
User 2 and User 3 can edit shared dasbhoard
Actual result:
User 2 that is the member of 2 groups can edit dashboard, User 3 that is member of Group A only - can only view
{noformat}
{code:java}
Additional Scenario 2:
Create 3 groups (Group1, Group2, Group3)
Create a User1, Add user to Group1, Group2
Add Group1, Group2 and Group3 as Viewers
In Editor add just a user: User1
User1 is member in Group1 and Group2 but not in Group3
User1 can't edit the dashboard, until added to Group3{code}
h3. Expected Results

_user1_ can edit the dashboard
h3. Actual Results

_user1_ cannot.
h3. Notes

If you removed _jira-administrators_ group from the list of editor, _user1_ is able to edit the dashboard.
h3. Workaround

Keep users always included in the group.
fields.summary: Adding group as dashboard editor removes some individual users' right to edit dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The often case, where users would have used JIRA Service Desk (JSD) in the instance but then decided to uninstall it. This will cause the JSD data to remain in the instance. At a later time, after the instance have been upgraded across major versions, the users may decide to use JSD again, without realizing they would run into some problems due to the old JSD data that needs to be upgraded according to the upgrade path ([Problem described here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/after-upgrading-to-jira-service-desk-3-2-x-or-greater-service-desk-project-s-navigation-bar-shows-unable-to-render-element-due-to-an-error-845943102.html]).

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a tool that will check the JIRA instance for any JSD data, even if JSD is currently inactive/not installed in the instance. The tool should notify the users that there are some JSD data in the JIRA instance and should prompt them to either upgrade it or remove it. Perhaps the tool can also be bundled with the installers for upgrades or included as part of the upgrade pre-requisite in the documentation.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Tool to check for existing JIRA Service Desk data prior to JIRA upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to install additional applications after migrating from Atlassian Cloud.
h3. Environment
 - Jira 8.1.0
 - (i) Not reproduced Jira 7.13.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate Jira Server from Cloud to Server
 -- [Migrating from Jira Cloud to Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/migrating-from-jira-cloud-to-server-776636236.html]
 # Install Jira Service Desk through the Versions & licenses page
 -- [Installing additional applications and version updates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/installing-additional-applications-and-version-updates-765593207.html]

h3. Expected Results

Jira Service Desk can be installed without any problem
h3. Actual Results

Display error "An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information." but the application is actually installed.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-18 at 17.02.14.png|thumbnail!

Following error in atlassian-jira.log
{code:java}
2019-04-18 06:10:02,842 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-1 WARN sysadmin 369x2419x1 vuqkwc 172.18.0.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [c.a.u.c.r.resources.install.InstallTask] Unexpected error in install task
java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to parse AuditLogEntry from JSON string: {"userKey":"Unknown user","accountId":"Unknown user","date":1553006411475,"i18nKey":"upm.auditLog.install.plugin.success","entryType":"PLUGIN_INSTALL","params":["Slack","jira-slack-integration","1010.0.0-AC"]}
	at com.atlassian.upm.core.log.PluginSettingsAuditLogService$3.apply(PluginSettingsAuditLogService.java:235)
	at com.atlassian.upm.core.log.PluginSettingsAuditLogService$3.apply(PluginSettingsAuditLogService.java:226)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$6.transform(Iterators.java:785)
...
Caused by: org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "accountId" (Class com.atlassian.upm.core.log.AuditLogEntryImpl), not marked as ignorable
 at [Source: java.io.StringReader@b702d30; line: 1, column: 210] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.upm.core.log.AuditLogEntryImpl["accountId"])
	at org.codehaus.jackson.map.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException.from(UnrecognizedPropertyException.java:53)
...
{code}
h3. Notes

Install app also return same error.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-18 at 16.59.38.png|thumbnail!

This problem is caused by the data which is imported from Cloud.
{code:java}
SELECT propertyvalue FROM propertytext where id = (SELECT id
FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'com.atlassian.upm.log.PluginSettingsAuditLogService:log:upm_audit_log_v3');
{code}
{code:java}
#java.util.List
{"userKey":"Unknown user","accountId":"Unknown user","date":1553006411475,"i18nKey":"upm.auditLog.install.plugin.success","entryType":"PLUGIN_INSTALL","params":["Slack","jira-slack-integration","1010.0.0-AC"]}
{"userKey":"Unknown user","accountId":"Unknown user","date":1553006410074,"i18nKey":"upm.auditLog.auto.update.plugin","entryType":"AUTO_PLUGIN_UPDATE","params":["Slack for Jira","1010.0.0-AC"]}
....
{code}
A key "accountId" is only used in Jira Cloud and it shouldn't exist in Jira Server.
h3. Workaround

Please remove the key "accountId" from the problematic record with SQL below. (This SQL is tested on PostgreSQL.)
{code:java}
UPDATE propertytext SET propertyvalue = REPLACE(propertyvalue, ',"accountId":"anonymous"', '')
        WHERE id = (
		SELECT id FROM propertyentry 
		WHERE property_key = 'com.atlassian.upm.log.PluginSettingsAuditLogService:log:upm_audit_log_v3');
{code}
If you've installed some apps on Jira Cloud, you also need to execute the following SQL.
{code:java}
UPDATE propertytext SET propertyvalue = REPLACE(propertyvalue, ',"accountId":"Unknown user"', '')
        WHERE id = (
		SELECT id FROM propertyentry 
		WHERE property_key = 'com.atlassian.upm.log.PluginSettingsAuditLogService:log:upm_audit_log_v3');
{code}
(i) Please make sure to take a backup before modifying the DB record.
fields.summary: Unable to install additional applications after migrating from Atlassian Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Typing a text at the comment field using the "Add Comment" Hyperlink from the notification mail and changing between the 'text/visual' tabs will cause a loss of entered-but-not-saved text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any issue and trigger a notification.
# Go to the Notification received by email and click on "Add Comment" hyperlink.
# A new browser tab will open with the BASE_URL/#add-comment anchor.
# Write a comment and click on the visual tab.
# Jira will simple lost the entered text.
# This time, if you copy the BASE_URL/#add-comment and paste it directly on the navigation bar on the browser, note the comment field will be displayed with the visual tab selected and if you type a text in the comment field and change the tab to text one, the browser will try to reload the page, asking to choose between "Cancel" or "OK". Any option you choose will reload it, giving you a totally blank page.

h3. Expected Results
Navigating through the tabs shouldn't cause text loss.

h3. Actual Results
Navigating through the tabs cause text loss.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Typing at the comment field using the "Add Comment" hyperlink from the notification mail plus changing between visual/text tabs will cause loss of entered-but-not-saved text.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is currently no official way to configure JIRA with two url and it is very common for organizations to have one internal and one external url. 

It is currently only possible to configure one baseurl and this is mentioned in our documentation :

# https://confluence.atlassian.com/upm/diagnosing-base-url-configuration-problems-273875734.html
# https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-application-options-938847824.html

bq. The base URL of this Jira installation. You can only configure Jira to respond to a single URL and this setting must match the URL that your users request for accessing your Jira instance. You cannot (for example) have a different hostname or URL for internal and external users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the functionality and official documentation on how to configure JIRA with internal and external or more than one url. 

h3. Notes

While one can configure multiple Tomcat connectors with different URLs, due to the nature of our current OAuth implementation signing requests with the base URL setting ( see https://docs.atlassian.com/DAC/javadoc/applinks/3.6.1/reference/com/atlassian/applinks/core/auth/oauth/RequestUtil.html ), using a different URL other than the base url will break integrations relying on OAuth for authentication
fields.summary: Officially provide support for internal and external base url for JIRA

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary When Notification Triggered From JIRA Service Desk, The Atlassian Logo Was Using JIRA Instance URL BASEURL. fields.description: Downloadable versions of this plugin jump from 3.2 (with support for Jira up to 7.12.3) to 3.5 which begins with Jira 8.0.0.
fields.summary: Make SSL for Jira compatible with 7.13.x

fields.description: We would like to use Jira mobile app and confluence mobile app in our environment with Intune.
fields.summary: Intune platform support with Jira Mobile and Confluence mobile

fields.description:
Use Case -  We have Epics and we have Stories. They have different workflows and different fields visible for each. We assigned a Story to a Sprint and then decided it was too much work and promoted the Story to an Epic. However, the Sprint field isn't exposed for Epics in our system, so we had to have a Jira Admin clear the field out for us to remove the item from our sprint board. 

Ideally, Jira would handle that conversion and ask the user what to do with fields that aren't exposed in the new issue type.
fields.summary: Ask user how to handle fields that aren't in the new issue type when converting issues

fields.description: Currently, it's not possible to return the order of a set of fields from an issue's {{createmeta}} via the REST API. It would be useful  to have an API call to retrieve the order of fields from the *Create Issue* screen for consistency purposes between the API and GUI.
fields.summary: API call to return a fields screen order

fields.description:
We need a means to pro actively find accounts which are locked by JIRA.

The account locked status is not search-able from the UI.

This makes it impossible to determine which accounts have been locked.

Having the ability to search would help us identify possible attempts to access an account from intruders.

Pro-actively identify user accounts locked so we can address the issue with the user to find out what the issue is.

Troubleshoot problems with our Active Directory when accounts introduced have problems that cause the login failures like a white space character at the end of the user-name has done.
fields.summary: Ability to search Locked user accounts from GUI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Deleting Attachment Link, It Converts The Text With Super Script In Firefox Only

h3. Environment
Tested on JIRA 8.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an attachment in ticket
# In Description, add the attachment and switch to visual mode
# Save it and edit the description again, it should show visual editing mode
# Highlight the attachment and replace it by key in *abc*
(i) Any character will do
# Switch back to text editing mode and you will see *^* superscript 

h3. Expected Results
ABC text should show with normal formatting

h3. Actual Results
JIRA shows it with superscript

h3. Workaround
Use Chrome as this only impacting to Firefox Browser
fields.summary: When Deleting Attachment Link, It Convert The Text With Super Script In Firefox Only

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The workflow error message in JIRA 7.13.1 seems slightly vague, hence it is not clear to the users why the error occurs. The error message was fine back in 7.3.2.

*7.13.1 Error message:*
 !message 7.13.1.png|thumbnail! 

*7.3.2 Error message:*
 !message 7.3.2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the workflow error message to include more details on why the error occurred so that users understand it better.

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Make workflow error message more verbose for the users

fields.description:
Currently each Status in Jira can have only one description.

A Status can be used with a different name as Step in a Workflow and one status can be used with sligltly different meaning in different Workflows. It would be an improvment if the status description (shown to end-users as tooltip by hovering over field "Status" in the issue details could be configurable.

Easiest way for achiving that would be a new property that can be set for steps in a Jira Workflow:
 * KEY: jira.step.description
 * VALUE: [STRING], vor Example: "This status is meant for...."

Other implementations are also possilbe
fields.summary: Enable Workflow-Specific Status Description by Step-Properties

fields.description:
When creating issue links between the rest API, you must specify a source, a destination, and a relationship.

If a relationship of the specified type (between the same issues) already exists, there should be no need to add it again, and instead return an appropriate response (400, 403, 409 or 422) to signify that the link would be a duplicate, and has been ignored.
fields.summary: The issueLink Rest API should not create duplicate links

fields.description:
As can be seen at [CWD-2768|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-2768] Crowd 3.3.0 supports LDAP connections using StartTLS.

Jira 8.1 (currently latest) embeds Crowd 2.10.5 libraries:
{noformat}
ecrmac-100878:lib fkraemer$ pwd
/Users/fkraemer/Downloads/atlassian-jira-software-8.1.0-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib
ecrmac-100878:lib fkraemer$ ls -la | grep embedded-crowd
-rw-r--r--@   1 fkraemer  staff    60770 Apr  4 09:06 embedded-crowd-api-2.10.5-j11.jar
-rw-r--r--@   1 fkraemer  staff    40299 Apr  4 09:06 embedded-crowd-core-2.10.5-j11.jar
-rw-r--r--@   1 fkraemer  staff     5500 Apr  4 09:06 embedded-crowd-spi-2.10.5-j11.jar
{noformat}

The embedded Crowd libraries must be updated in Jira so as to allow LDAP connections using StartTLS.
fields.summary: LDAP connection supports StartTLS

fields.description:
Hi,

 

Jira admin can enable notification to specific role. Project admins can add jira-user group to the role and end up sending notification to all the active Jira users. 

 

This might cause issue for instances with thousands of active users.  Provide option to disable notification for specific group or atleast for jira-user usergroup.
fields.summary: Enable option to disable jira-user group from notification

# Go to user profile (or go to the Project summary)

# To me the loudhailer symbolizes something different than "Feedback" (more like "Broadcast"). Change it?
fields.summary: The feedback icon could be better

fields.description:
Hi Jira Server mobile app beta users,

We recently discovered a bug where Jira Server mobile app users receive *all* comment notifications from Jira issues they’re watching or assigned to, even if the comment had been restricted to exclude them. This means they’ll be able to view the content of comments that they shouldn’t have access to.

This issue is only relevant for instances with Jira Mobile plugin v *0.2.4* installed from the marketplace.
h3. Workaround

We’ve fixed the bug, and released a new version of the Mobile plugin for Jira. We strongly recommend you upgrade to the latest version [here|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220151/mobile-plugin-for-jira].

Thanks,

James Gabb
 Jira Server mobile product manager
fields.summary: User are receiving mobile notifications of restricted Jira comments that they cannot view when accessing Jira through a browser

fields.description:
The new Jira mobile plugin was released at Summit 2019: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/jira-software-mobile-app-966063511.html

It would be great to have this backported into the enterprise release version of Jira 7.13.latest since this is what enterprise customers are recommended to use.
fields.summary: Make Jira Mobile App Back ported into Enterprise Release Version

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when copying and pasting text from the CLI using macOS or Linux using the *Visual* mode on Jira, it will keep the line break from the text copied from the CLI.

h3. Suggested Solution

Ensure that Jira can handle this automatically and remove the line breaks.

h3. Workaround

Use *Text* mode instead on Jira, as it will remove the line breaks.
fields.summary: Remove CLI line breaks automatically on Visual mode

fields.description:
While in Project A (no security level), creating a linked issue that exists in Project B (issue security applied) does not apply Project B's default issue security level. 

*Expected Result:* New linked issue inherits projects B's issue security level.

*Actual Result:* New linked issue for project B has no issue security applied.

*Steps to Reproduce:*

**You will require two Jira projects. Project A has no issue security. Project B has issue security with default level configured.

1) Create an issue that belongs to Project A
 2) On that issue click on "More"
 3) Click on Create Linked Issue
 4) On the Create Linked Issue dialog, select Project B
 4.1) Jira project B is using an Issue Security Level Scheme with a Default level
 5) On the Create Linked Issue dialog, select the issue type Task
 6) Fill in all the required fields, and then click on Create
 7) The resulting created issues in project B, let's say B-1, does not have any Security Level
 8) Hit the Create button on the top Nav Bar
 9) On the Create dialog select project B and issue type Task
 10) Fill in all the required fields, and then click on Create
 11) The resulting created issue in project B, B-1, does have a Security Level, which is the Default Level of the Issue Security Scheme configured in project B

*Workaround:* None known at this time.
fields.summary: Creating linked issue from one project in another project does not apply default Issue security level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The default dropdown menu size is rather limited that can only display few options. This will be troublesome for lists with a lot of options as users will need to scroll a lot.

 !defaultSelectList.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a configuration for the Select List Custom Fields to increase the number of options shown

 !enhancedSelectList.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Dropdown menu configuration to increase number of options shown

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Issue Navigator allows re-ordering of items in search results temporarily (mostly for visualization apparently - since this doesn't actually update the issues, re-prioritise or re-rank them in any way in the backend). One draw-back with this feature, is that it gets in the way of simple copy and paste of content (e.g. copying (HTML) rows of issues that can be embedded into an email, document, blog post etc. - very useful) from the issue navigator. Select and copy of rows becomes impossible except when selecting from the very top of the table because the cursor switches to the draggable-mode when you try to select any rows except from the top row.

h3. Suggested Solution
The ability to select and copy content from the issue navigator may actually be of more practical advantage than the ability to drag things around.
* Improve the issue navigator styling so that it's still possible to select and copy any rows from the issue navigator table.
* Provide a way to disable the dragable feature in favor of ability to select and copy, if we can't have both at the same time.
 
h3. Workaround
* If you switch the issue navigator to printable view, there is no drag and drop feature in that layout, and copying and pasting text is possible from any part of the table.
** Ofcourse this adds one additional step that is hard to get all users to be familiar with or remember just for a simple 'copy text' support that should always be available consistently on a web interface.
* It is possible to disable the dragging of subtask through the use of a dark feature.  
*# Login to Jira as an administrator
 *# Navigate to $JIRAbaseURL/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
 *# add the value of  *{color:#333333}com.atlassian.jira.issuetable.draggable.disabled{color}* to the enable dark feature and click Add
However this will prevent the dragging of subtasks both on the issue details page and through the issue navigator.  Note:  In the issue details view you will still see the up and down arrows that can be used to rearrange the order of these subtasks.

h3. Notes
This isn't a trivial requirement if we consider that versatility of interacting with content is supposed to be a key advantage of web interfaces. Having select and copy disabled or impaired unintentionally like this, is a regression of basic web browsing functionality.
* Taking screenshots of parts of the issue navigator as an alternative to select and copy is far less useful, as it doesn't have the advantage of clickable links that you get when you select and copy the content instead.
fields.summary: Drag and drop behavior on issue navigator gets in the way of selecting content to copy

fields.description: Whenever you're configuring a new field configuration, every click of Hide on a field setting refreshes the page so that it starts again at the very top.  It would be immensely appreciated if there was either a "Hide all button", a menu item to set field configurations in JQL searches, or at minimum, a checkbox for all fields in a field configuration similar to that of the screens list.  Thank you.
fields.summary: Allow quick configuration of fields in field configuration list

fields.description:
We are seeing mentions of Bitbucket in the Jira logs, when we are not even connected to Bitbucket. We are only connected to Github. This appears as the reference is being used in one of the following DVCS classes, somewhere deep down in the code:
c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositorySyncServiceImpl
com.atlassian.jira.plugin.dvcs.service


{code:java}
 Caesium-1-4 WARN ServiceRunner [c.a.j.p.dvcs.service.RepositorySyncServiceImpl] Repo list had updates when DB reconciled with bitbucket. 
:
:
referencing GitHub Repositories... 
:

{code}

This is causing confusions among our customers as they wonder why the log which is for Github repositories, it is referencing Bitbucket when they have never had Bitbucket connected to their instance. 

There is no workaround at this point.
fields.summary: Reference to bitbucket in Jira logs, when using Github and not Bitbucket.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Filter with multiple nested filters within it
# Perform the search
# Now, break the filters into their JQL directly
# Perform the same search. 

h3. Expected Results

The queries take the same time to provide the result.

h3. Actual Results

The JQL using multiple nested filters is way slower.

h3. Workaround

Currently, no work arounds other than avoid using nested filters.
fields.summary: Search with multiple nested filters is slower than pure JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

* The current version of Tomcat 8.5.35 bundled with JIRA 8.0 is vulnerable to Denial of Service CVE-2019-0199. 
https://tomcat.apache.org/security-8.html#Fixed_in_Apache_Tomcat_8.5.38

h3. Fixed Versions
* >= 8.5.38
* >= 9.0.16

h3. Workaround
* Upgrade Tomcat via the steps mentioned in https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-upgrade-apache-tomcat-version-in-jira-7-x-879957866.html?
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to the version 8.5.38 and later

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The JIRA indexing failed with the following error after change a customfield name to a empty space:
{noformat}
2019-04-10 16:52:41,921 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN admin 1012x278x1 1lgfgnu 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] Indexing failed for Issue - '10100'
2019-04-10 16:52:41,921 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 WARN admin 1012x278x1 1lgfgnu 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder] com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.atlassian.cache.CacheException: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$BlankStringArgumentException: names[0] should not be empty!
2019-04-10 16:52:41,925 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1012x278x1 1lgfgnu 127.0.0.1 /secure/admin/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.j.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField] Exception during searcher initialization of the custom field com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:textsearcher:
com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$BlankStringArgumentException: names[0] should not be empty!
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions.containsNoBlanks(Assertions.java:146)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.<init>(ClauseNames.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.<init>(ClauseNames.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.ClauseNames.forCustomField(ClauseNames.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.getClauseNames(ImmutableCustomField.java:310)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.searchers.TextSearcher.init(TextSearcher.java:61)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the "Normal" create button to create a new issue and at the same time adding it to an epic by populating the "Epic Link" field a IssueLinkCreatedEvent is fired as one might expect.

But, if you currently have an Epic open, and click the little + "Create issue in epic" button next to the list "Issues in Epic" three link events are fired: IssueLinkCreatedEvent, IssueLinkDeletedEvent, IssueLinkCreatedEvent separately and immediately after each other.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a webhook with events:
#* Issue link: created, deleted
 # Create an issue inside the Epic using the + 

h3. Expected Results

One IssueLinkCreatedEvent is fired 

h3. Actual Results

 Three link events are fired: IssueLinkCreatedEvent, IssueLinkDeletedEvent, IssueLinkCreatedEvent

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Triple events triggered at creation of Issue inside the epic

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting is not reflected when installing a fresh Jira, or when clicking on the revert button:
 - when Jira is installed, the text color is showing as grey in the drop down menu, although it is set to white in ⚙ > System > Look and feel
 - if the color is changed to a non-white color in ⚙ > System > Look and feel and then it is set back to white by using the *Revert* button, the color is not changed back to white in the drop down menu

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira
 # Go to ⚙ > System > Look and feel and check the current setting: notice that it's set to white
 !Step1.png|thumbnail!
 # Check the text color in the *Projects* dropdown menu and notice that it's grey (not expected)
 !Step2.png|thumbnail!
 # Go back to ⚙ > System > Look and feel
 # Change the "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting to purple
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 # Check the text color in the *Projects* dropdown menu and notice that it's purple (expected)
 !Step4.png|thumbnail!
 # Go back to ⚙ > System > Look and feel and click on the *Revert* button next to the "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting
 !Step5.png|thumbnail!
 # Check the text color in the *Projects* dropdown menu

h3. Expected Results

The color of the text should be white.
h3. Actual Results

The color of the text is still purple (not expected):
 !Step6.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Go to ⚙ > System > Look and feel
 # Change the "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting to a non-white color
 # Change the "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting back to white *manually* either by moving the cursor to the white color area instead of using the *Revert* button
 !Step7.png|thumbnail!
 # The text will show as white:
 !Step8.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The "Menu Item Highlight Text Color" setting is not reflected when installing a fresh JIRA, or when clicking on the revert button

fields.description:
When searching issues through the basic mode, the system does not respect the selected project if a saved filter is first executed - and you then add in the epic link column. When typing in keywords, the system will provide epics from all other projects that match the supplied text.

 
 *Steps to reproduce:*
 Create two projects
 Create a saved filter: “project = oneOfTheTwoProjectsHere”
 Create an Epic and issue for each project, and link each of the Epic to one issue each
  
 &
  
 In Basic issue search mode - execute the saved filter
 Add the ‘Epic Link’ column
 Type in the Epic link box, and observe the suggestions are not project based
  
 *Expected Result:*
 The suggestions provided by the Epic Link field only show Epic Links within the chosen project.
  
 *Actual Result:*
 The suggestions provided by the Epic Link field do not adhere to the project selected in the search.
fields.summary: Executing a Saved Filter and then adding in ‘Epic Link’ column/keyword provides suggestions outside of the chosen Project.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently we cannot specify where the board would live (show up under). If you have a board with filter {{Project in (ABC, XYZ)}} the board would show up under both project. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for users to specify the location (Project(s)) where the board would appear. 

h4. Notes
* This feature is currently available in Jira cloud, however, it is limited to specifying only one project.
fields.summary: Allow option to specify location(s) where a board will live

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scope of Webhook all 'Version' events doesn't get limited to the JQL specified

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a Webhook in Jira with the following configuration: 
#* JQL : {{project = "Sample Scrum Project"}}
#* Select all of the versions events
# Perform any event for versions in another project like XYZ

h3. Expected Results

# The webhooks should not be triggered

h3. Actual Results

The webhook is triggered

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Scope of Webhook all 'Version' events doesn't get limited to the JQL specified

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

{{DailyAlertAnalyticsJob}} is a part of Atlassian Diagnostics integration plugin.
 Its responsibility is to produce daily analytics summary on all alerts fired with Atlassian diagnostics framework.

Its memory usage can get quite heavy with lots of alerts fired daily. Memory will be accumulated in {{Caesium-x-y}} thread
h3. Expected Results

{{DailyAlertAnalyticsJob}} efficiently handles its memory footprint by properly streaming alerts instead of loading all into memory.
h3. Actual Results

{{DailyAlertAnalyticsJob}} loads all alerts from a given day into memory causing high pressure on GC, eventually leading to OOMe on big instances.
h3. Workaround

*Option 1* - *recommended*

Alerting thresholds are set by several application properties.
 Setting them high enough to produce less alerts per day is a viable workaround for the issue.

Currently implemented alerting thresholds:
||Property||Default value||Explanation||
|jira.diagnostics.thresholds.slow-query-millis|400 ms|Alert for slow JQL query|
|jira.diagnostics.thresholds.number-of-results|1000|Number of returned issues from a single JQL query|
|jira.diagnostics.thresholds.query-complexity|1000|Lucene query complexity - number of claues the query is constructed of|

Setting these values high can reduce the number of alerts triggered daily.
 * These values can be modified either from the $JIRA_HOME/jira-config.properties. For example,
{noformat}
jira.diagnostics.thresholds.slow-query-millis=5000 
jira.diagnostics.thresholds.number-of-results=10000 
{noformat}

 * Or they can be modified using the following JVM parameters,
{noformat}
-Djira.diagnostics.thresholds.slow-query-millis=5000 
-Djira.diagnostics.thresholds.number-of-results=10000  
{noformat}
(!) Make sure there is no space between the equal sign in both methods.

*Option 2*  - *recommended*

Retention period for alerts is 30 days by default. You can decrease database size by changing it to e.g. 1 day.

 In order to do that you can use the Jira property *com.atlassian.jira.health.diagnostics.alerts.retention-period-days.* To do this, open the jira-config.properties and add/edit the following metric:
  - {{com.atlassian.jira.health.diagnostics.alerts.retention-period-days}}: <number of days to retain Diagnostics Alerts> (It is 30 by default)
 * For more information on how to configure the file, see [jira-config.properties file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-edit-the-jira-config-properties-file-317194938.html]. 

*Option 3*

You can temporary disable the plugin via UPM. However we *do not recommend* disabling it as problems with Diagnostics could be only a symptom of underlying root cause (it might be harder to track without Diagnostics plugin).
fields.summary: Atlassian Jira Diagnostics bundled plugin high memory usage
